title: UK weather: Almost 100 flood warnings in place after rain batters the country
text:
Almost 100 flood warnings are in place for the UK after weekend rain battered the country. While the situation looks like it will slightly improve by Monday as the vast amounts of floodwater choking Britain's roads slowly drains away, there will still be warnings in place.

As of 4pm on Sunday, there were 90 flood warnings across the UK and 120 flood alerts.

Heavy rain on Friday and Saturday led to several football matches being cancelled, train delays and flooded roads.

Parts of York city centre are under water after the Ouse broke its banks and fire crews were seen assisting residents in Hereford after the Rive Wye overflowed.

Trains across the country were also cancelled or delayed throughout the weekend as tracks flooded.

BBC gardener Monty Don was also caught up in the chaos, and was trapped in his home in Herefordshire as the rain blocked the roads.
description: Almost 100 flood warnings are in place for the UK after weekend rain battered the country.
